com.ntnu.solbrille.index
Class BasicNavigableKeyValueIndex<K extends IndexKeyEntry<K>,V extends IndexEntry>

java.lang.Object
  java.util.AbstractMap<K,V>
      java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentSkipListMap<K,V>
          com.ntnu.solbrille.index.BasicNavigableKeyValueIndex<K,V>
All Implemented Interfaces:
Index, KeyValueIndex<K,V>, NavigableKeyValueIndex<K,V>, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentMap<K,V>, java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentNavigableMap<K,V>, java.util.Map<K,V>, java.util.NavigableMap<K,V>, java.util.SortedMap<K,V>
public class BasicNavigableKeyValueIndex<K extends IndexKeyEntry<K>,V extends IndexEntry>
extends java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentSkipListMap<K,V>
implements NavigableKeyValueIndex<K,V>

Basic implementation of an in-memory navigable key value index. Based on the concurrent skip-list map from the JDK.

Version:
$Id $.
Author:
Ola Natvig
See Also:
Serialized Form

Method Detail

initializeFromFile

public void initializeFromFile(BufferPool bufferPool,
                               int fileNumber,
                               long blockOffset)
                        throws java.io.IOException,
                               java.lang.InterruptedException
Description copied from interface: Index
Initialize the index from a file. This may for in-memory structures be to read the content of the file into memory, or for disk based indexes to establish a point of refference in the underlying file.

The format file recieved of this method should be compatible with the data dumped by the dumpToFile methods.

Specified by:
initializeFromFile in interface Index
Parameters:
bufferPool - The buffer pool managing the file.
fileNumber - The file number.
blockOffset - The block offset into the file where the index is stored.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - On IO related errors.
java.lang.InterruptedException - If the current thread is interupted.

initializeFromFile

public void initializeFromFile(BufferPool bufferPool,
                               int fileNumber,
                               long blockOffset,
                               int byteOffset)
                        throws java.io.IOException,
                               java.lang.InterruptedException
Description copied from interface: Index
Overload of the initializeFromFile method with byte offset into the first block of the file.

Specified by:
initializeFromFile in interface Index
Parameters:
bufferPool - The buffer pool managing the file.
fileNumber - The file number.
blockOffset - The block offset into the file where the index is stored.
byteOffset - The number of bytes into the first block of the file the index starts.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - On IO related errors.
java.lang.InterruptedException - If the current thread is interupted.

writeToFile

public void writeToFile(BufferPool bufferPool,
                        int fileNumber,
                        long blockOffset)
                 throws java.io.IOException,
                        java.lang.InterruptedException
Description copied from interface: Index
Writes this index structure to file, for in-memory indexes this will be to dump the content of the index into the file. For disk based indexes it will suffice to make sure that all data in the index is reflected on disk.

Specified by:
writeToFile in interface Index
Parameters:
bufferPool - The buffer pool managing the file.
fileNumber - The file number.
blockOffset - The block offset into the file where the index should be stored.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - On IO related errors.
java.lang.InterruptedException - If the current thread is interupted.

getOnDiskSize

public Pair<java.lang.Long,java.lang.Integer> getOnDiskSize()
Description copied from interface: Index
Gets the on disk size of the index. May be used to place multiple indices in the same file etc.

Specified by:
getOnDiskSize in interface Index
Returns:
A pair of the block and byte size of the entry, null if no good estimate exists.
